main.name: Rohan Paul
main.occupation: React and ReactNative Front End Engineer
main.description: Building products in Web and Mobile over the lat 2 years working in very early stage startup world.
main.bio: MBA (Finance) by academic qualification, however I made a drastic career transformation from International Banking to Software Engineering for my love of coding & building products.  After 10 years of working in Global Investment banking credit risk & financial analysis (of which last 3 years was in Deutsche Bank, Sydney, Australia), I started my Software Engineering journey in mid-2018, after completing a three-month full-time web-development bootcamp . I am also an active programming blogger.

education.description: Completed a full-time three months full-stack bootcamp where I learned and did projects in Mongo, React, Node, Express stack
Describe your experience at school, what you learned, what useful skills you have acquired etc.

work.company: Atlantis Capital (very early stage startup in stealth mode)
work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: Developing the complete web and mobile front-end of our Fin-Tech app in React-Redux and React-Native respectively from Sketch / Zeplin file given by design team.  Achieving pixel-perfection and strict adherence to principles of responsiveness.

work.title: Associate Software Engineer
work.description: Worked in full-stack web-application projects with React, Redux, Node, Express, MongoDB, building and automating Shipping/Port system’s physical assets and manual documentation processes through Web Applications. Built and deployed two full end-to-end applications.

work.title: Associate–Credit Risk Management
work.description: Was chosen internally to move internationally from Deutsche Bank-Mumbai to Deutsche Bank-Sydney because of my high performance. In Sydney managed a portfolio of ~50 large industrial companies mitigating credit losses. (These companies are corporate clients of Deutsche Bank, having a minimum market value of $500mn ).

work.title: Team Manager of North-American Credit Analysis Team
work.description: Financial Analysis and Financial Model building (of corporate clients of Deutsche Bank) credit rating & writing the report. I was responsible for a portfolio of 80 large companies spanning North-American-Insurance sector, USA government Municipalities and few large Banks.

work.title: Associate–Credit Research
work.description: Worked on financial forecast model building (Excel based) of private equity clients of Advenity and supporting the onshore analysts in maintaining and building valuation models (based on fundamental financial analysis).

work.title: Team Leader of US Financial Group Credit Analysis Team
work.description: Financial analysis, Credit ratings and credit report writing for HSBC’s corporate clients

work.title: Associate – Finance & Management Information Analytics /
work.description: Worked on Business intelligence reporting to HSBC senior management, using query tools like BusinessObject that will hit a SQL database

projects.title: A Landing Page Theme (for a school website)
projects.category: Built with React, including Login Functionality with json-web-token and Passport middleware authentication

projects.title: Fury Fighting Gear
projects.category: (offline now) A fighting gear company I started

projects.title: Original Thai Food
projects.category: Website I built for a restaurant I like in Thailand

projects.title: Resume Website
projects.category: A React based resume website template

projects.title: Smirkspace
projects.category: (MVP Only) A React and Meteor based chat University project.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Rohan Paul must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
